intro: Adenocarpus telonensis var. rodriguezii, commonly known as the Rodriguez's hairy thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in soft hairs. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and scrub areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
